newsitem.title: UK: HORSE RACING-IN COMMAND STAKES 1997 GUINEAS PLACE.
newsitem.headline: HORSE RACING-IN COMMAND STAKES 1997 GUINEAS PLACE.

text.p: In Command, a 10-1 chance ridden by Michael Hills, won the group one Dewhurst Stakes on Friday to stake his claim as a 1997 classic candidate.
In Command, trained by Barry Hills for Sheikh Maktoum al Maktoum, had a head to spare over Musical Pursuit (13-2), the mount of Pat Eddery.

The Dewhurst occasionally produces a 2,000 Guineas winner, although bookmakers were not too impressed, quoting the colt at 25-1. But jockey Hills was more enthusiastic, saying: "He will be a stronger horse next year."
Earlier, the Rockfel Stakes, a race for two-year-old fillies, was won by Moonlight Paradise, ridden by Frankie Dettori for the Godolphin group.
Moonlight Paradise took over the running 400 metres out to beat Dazzle by two and a half lengths.
Moonlight Paradise is now 7-1 for next year's 1,000 Guineas with Dazzle at 14-1.
